posts.content: Hi all I'm still looking for a split project or very similar and very new to all this what are the Brazil ones like as there seems to be a lot on eBay plus iv only got 9 grand lol any help ideas would be great yours andy

If you're after a project you may get one for £9k but be prepared to either be a dab hand with a welder and have a few grand for decent spare panels, or spend £10k easily on an average resto.

You won't get a decent splitty done cheaply, you're better off in the long run buying one that's been sorted, but that will be out of your budget by the sound of things.

The trouble is once you start spending it never seems to end...

JonnyCJ wrote:The trouble is once you start spending it never seems to end...


Correction: The trouble is once you start spending it never seems to ends...

True - 3 years in and can almost see light at the end of the tunnel.

But I know it's just a train coming the other way.
